metadata.Title: CVE-2016-3955 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
The usbip_recv_xbuff function in drivers/usb/usbip/usbip_common.c in theLinux kernel before 4.5.3 allows remote attackers to cause a denial ofservice (out-of-bounds write) or possibly have unspecified other impact viaa crafted length value in a USB/IP packet.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-3955` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.13.0-87-generic - 3.13.0-87.133
linux-image-3.13.0-87-generic-lpae - 3.13.0-87.133
linux-image-3.13.0-87-lowlatency - 3.13.0-87.133

linux-image-3.13.0-87-powerpc64-smp - 3.13.0-87.133
linux-image-extra-3.13.0-87-generic - 3.13.0-87.133
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.13.0-87.133').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
